main_definition: WMA stands for Wide Minimum Acceptable Ratio, a tool used in digital audio processing to measure the perceptual difference between two audio signals.

meanings_and_examples.example: Aspiring musicians often learn how to use software like Ableton Live or FL Studio as a digital audio workstation.
The ratio of the input volume level to the output volume level, which is used in audio processing for controlling the dynamic range of an audio signal.

A tool developed by Microsoft that compares two audio signals and determines if they are perceptually indistinguishable, even in cases where traditional RMS (Root Mean Square) differences would not be noticeable.
